amendment.description: Amendment prohibits any funds from being extended to Mexico unless the appropriate Federal entity or official through which the funds will be extended is apprised of the fact that Mexico has decreased the level of drug traffic into the United States, as determined by the Director of the Office of National Drug Control Policy.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed in as amendment No. 81 in the Congressional Record of June 27, 1995, to prohibit any funds appropriated in the bill to provide assistance for Mexico reduces the drugs entering the U.S. from Mexico by 10% from the previous year, and apprehends and prosecutes individuals involved in corruption, drug trafficking or money laundering, and pursues international anti-drug trafficking initiatives.
